intro: Catabrosella variegata subsp. leiantha, commonly known as the variegated catabrosella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves with green and white patterns. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
